House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00026
FULL TITLE : NEED TO END THE ILLEGAL USE OF PUBLIC WATERS OF THE COUNTRY
SHORT TITLE : Water Problem
ABSTRACT : Recognized by the Chair, Rep. Jose L. Atienza Jr. from Buhay Party-List spoke on the importance of water to the lives of the people and the worsening state of bodies of waters such as lakes and rivers in the country. In particular, he discussed the condition of the Laguna de Bay which he said was slowly deteriorating because of over construction of fish pens built by their abusive owners. As he called on the Body to put an end to the illegal use of the country’s public waters, he also informed them that his Party-List Buhay has been crafting measures which would help save the lakes and rivers of the country. Moreover, he asked the support of the Members to make it mandatory that all household structures, and buildings be provided with water catchment facility for the reuse of water; and for LGUs to be responsible for all the water bodies in their respective areas of jurisdiction. With the present government bent on helping fishermen in the country, Rep. Atienza said that Congress should support the efforts of the President so that the present and future generations of Filipinos would benefit from fresh water which is now getting scarce all over the world. He then appealed to his colleagues to give serious attention to the problem of saving the bodies of water in the country. (SOURCE: House Journal No.7,p.45)
